jobDescription: Department:IN301_64704 UCO - Clinical Operation ImproExpected Weekly Hours:40Shift:Day ShiftPosition Purpose:POSITION PURPOSEProvides operational support for the measurement and improvement of clinical quality, cost, and the experience in care.Job Description Details:POSITION PURPOSEProvides operational support for the measurement and improvement of clinical quality, cost, and the experience in care.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSKnows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices and decisions.Responsible for multiple projects or clinical areas. These projects will be moderately complex in nature, with potential overlap between multiple clinical areas. Proficient in the use of SAS software to create datasets for analysis from multiple sources. Write SQL queries for data manipulation, sorting, summarizing, and reporting.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to developing, implementing, and utilizing databases and reporting tools to extract data, generate reports, perform moderate to complex data analysis and draft system/process improvement recommendations. Assignments may require interfacing with, gathering information from and making presentations to various levels of management and internal and external stakeholders. Will serve as a subject matter expert by providing guidance and by problem solving issues for internal colleagues on matters impacting projects or service area assignments.Performance Measurement and AnalysisPrepares the quantitative measurement and analysis of clinical quality, cost, and experience in care measures for assigned projects or clinical areas.Supports the establishment of quantitative measurement and targets based on environmental scans of national quality measurement organizations, clinical societies/associations, payers or regulatory programs. Monitors changes to definitions and works with stakeholders to establish new measures or to refine existing ones.Regularly monitors performance and highlights trends and opportunities for improvements to leaders and stakeholders.Supports the design, collection and analysis of data describing structure, process, or outcomes in care settings across the continuum. Information SharingSupports the preparation and dissemination of knowledge via presentations, publications, website postings, and applications as requested by stakeholders in the organization. Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and InclusionTrinity Health employs more than 120,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 21 states.
